alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 6:02PM MST until August 12 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND EAST CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 602 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Jackrabbit Wash. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tonopah, Gladden, Wenden, Salome, Aguila, Harcuvar, Vicksburg Junction, Vicksburg and Brenda. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 72 between mile markers 39 and 48. US Highway 60 between mile markers 35 and 44. AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 37 and 46. This includes the following streams and drainages... Winters Wash, Dead Horse Wash, Beer Bottle Wash, Bullard Wash, Cunningham Wash, Calcite Wash, Centennial Wash, Fourmile Wash, Delaney Wash, Red Cloud Wash, Powerline Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Tiger Wash, Browns Canyon Wash, Pump Mine Wash, Mill Wash, Grass Wash, Hartman Wash, Old Camp Wash, Star Wash, Salome Wash, Bouse Wash, Daggs Wash, Jimmie Wash, Hassayampa River, Woodchopper Wash, Coyote Wash and Alamo Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
